intro: Hedychium forrestii var. latibracteatum, commonly known as the broad-bract ginger, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant features tall, slender stems with narrow, sword-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spike of large, showy flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant appearance and tropical aesthetic.
